tool_description: QuantiModo will automatically aggregate life-tracking data from your users apps and devices with a single API.  It can then analyze this data allowing you to provide your users with actionable insights they can use to optimize their lives.
name: QuantiModo
title: QuantiModo

api_list.name: Correlations
api_list.description: Get correlations

optional_parameters.name: sort
optional_parameters.description: Sort by given field. If the field is prefixed with `-, it will sort in descending order.

optional_parameters.name: cause
optional_parameters.description: ORIGINAL variable name of the cause variable for which the user desires correlations

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: The LIMIT is used to limit the number of results returned. So if you have 1000 results, but only want to the first 10, you would set this to 10 and offset to 0.

optional_parameters.name: offset
optional_parameters.description: Now suppose you wanted to show results 11-20. You'd set the offset to 10 and the limit to 10.

optional_parameters.name: effect
optional_parameters.description: ORIGINAL variable name of the effect variable for which the user desires correlations

api_list.name: Get embeddable connect javascript
api_list.description: Get embeddable connect javascript

required_parameters.name: t
required_parameters.description: User token

api_list.name: Disconnect
api_list.description: The disconnect method deletes any stored tokens or connection information from the connectors database.

required_parameters.name: connector
required_parameters.description: Lowercase system name of the source application or device. Get a list of available connectors from the /connectors/list endpoint.

api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://quantimodo-quantimodo-v1.p.rapidapi.com/connectors/fitbit/disconnect"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "quantimodo-quantimodo-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://quantimodo-quantimodo-v1.p.rapidapi.com/connectors/{connector}/disconnect"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "quantimodo-quantimodo-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Measurement Time Range
api_list.description: Get Unix time-stamp (epoch time) of the user's first and last measurements taken.

optional_parameters.name: sources
optional_parameters.description: Enter source name to limit to specific source (varchar)

optional_parameters.name: user
optional_parameters.description: If not specified, uses currently logged in user (bigint)

api_list.name: Connect
api_list.description: Attempt to obtain a token from the data provider, store it in the database. With this, the connector to continue to obtain new user data until the token is revoked.

required_parameters.name: connector
required_parameters.description: Lowercase system name of the source application or device. Get a list of available connectors from the /connectors/list endpoint.

api_list.name: Get Info About a Variable
api_list.description: Get all of the settings and information about a variable by its name.  If the logged in user has modified the settings for the variable, these will be provided instead of the default settings for that variable.

required_parameters.name: variablename
required_parameters.description: Variable name

        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Search Variables
api_list.description: Get variables containing the search characters for which the currently logged in user has measurements. Used to provide auto-complete function in variable search boxes.

required_parameters.name: search
required_parameters.description: Search query which may be an entire variable name or a fragment of one.

optional_parameters.name: source
optional_parameters.description: Specify a data source name to only return variables from a specific data source.

optional_parameters.name: categoryname
optional_parameters.description: Filter variables by category name. The variable categories include Activity, Causes of Illness, Cognitive Performance, Conditions, Environment, Foods, Location, Miscellaneous, Mood, Nutrition, Physical Activity, Physique, Sleep, Social Interactions, Symptoms, Treatments, Vital Signs, and Work.

api_list.name: Variables
api_list.description: Returns all variables for which the user has measurements by the category name

optional_parameters.name: category
optional_parameters.description: Filter data by category

optional_parameters.name: sort
optional_parameters.description: Sort by given field. If the field is prefixed with `-, it will sort in descending order.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: The LIMIT is used to limit the number of results returned. So if you have 1000 results, but only want to the first 10, you would set this to 10 and offset to 0.

optional_parameters.name: offset
optional_parameters.description: Now suppose you wanted to show results 11-20. You'd set the offset to 10 and the limit to 10.

optional_parameters.name: userId
optional_parameters.description: User Id

api_list.name: Search Correlations
api_list.description: Returns the average correlations from all users for all public variables that contain the characters in the search query.

required_parameters.name: search
required_parameters.description: Name of the variable that you want to know the causes or effects of.

required_parameters.name: effectorcause
required_parameters.description: Specifies whehter to return the effects or causes of the searched variable.

api_list.name: Connection Instructions
api_list.description: Returns instructions that describe what parameters and endpoint to use to connect to the given data provider.

required_parameters.name: url
required_parameters.description: URL which should be used to enable the connector.

required_parameters.name: parameters
required_parameters.description: JSON Array of Parameters for the request to enable connector.

required_parameters.name: connector
required_parameters.description: Lowercase system name of the source application or device. Get a list of available connectors from the /connectors/list endpoint.

optional_parameters.name: usePopup
optional_parameters.description: Should use popup when enabling connector

api_list.name: Get Authorization Token
api_list.description: Ask the user if they want to allow a client applications to submit or obtain data from their QM account.

required_parameters.name: response_type
required_parameters.description: If the value is code, launches a Basic flow, requiring a POST to the token endpoint to obtain the tokens. If the value is token id_token or id_token token, launches an Implicit flow, requiring the use of Javascript at the redirect URI to retrieve tokens from the URI #fragment.

required_parameters.name: redirect_uri
required_parameters.description: The redirect URI is the URL within your client application that will receive the OAuth2 credentials.

required_parameters.name: client_id
required_parameters.description: This is the unique ID that QuantiModo uses to identify your application. Obtain a client id by emailing info@quantimo.do.

required_parameters.name: client_secret
required_parameters.description: This is the secret for your obtained clietn_id. QuantiModo uses this to validate that only your application uses the client_id.

optional_parameters.name: scope
optional_parameters.description: Scopes include basic, readmeasurements, and writemeasurements.  The "basic" scope allows you to read user info (displayname, email, etc). The "readmeasurements" scope allows one to read a user's data. The "writemeasurements" scope allows you to write user data. Separate multiple scopes by a space.

optional_parameters.name: realm
optional_parameters.description: Name of the realm representing the users of your distributed applications and services.  A "realm" attribute MAY be included to indicate the scope of protection.

optional_parameters.name: state
optional_parameters.description: An opaque string that is round-tripped in the protocol; that is to say, it is returned as a URI parameter in the Basic flow, and in the URI #fragment in the Implicit flow.  The state can be useful for correlating requests and responses. Because your redirect_uri can be guessed, using a state value can increase your assurance that an incoming connection is the result of an authentication request. If you generate a random string or encode the hash of some client state (e.g., a cookie) in this state variable, you can validate the response to additionally ensure that the request and response originated in the same browser. This provides protection against attacks such as cross-site request forgery.

api_list.name: Search user correlations for a given effect
api_list.description: Returns average of all correlations and votes for all user cause variables for a given effect.

api_list.name: Search user correlations for a given cause
api_list.description: Returns average of all correlations and votes for all user effect variables for a given cause.

api_list.name: Search public correlations for a given cause
api_list.description: Returns average of all correlations and votes for all public cause variables for a given cause.

api_list.name: Me
api_list.description: Returns user info for the currently authenticated user.

api_list.name: Public Variables
api_list.description: This endpoint retrieves an array of all public variables. Public variables are things like foods, medications, symptoms, conditions, and anything not unique to a particular user. For instance, a telephone number or name would not be a public variable.

api_list.name: User tokens for existing users, Create new users
api_list.description: Get user tokens for existing users or Create new users

required_parameters.name: body
required_parameters.description: Provides organization token and user ID

api_list.name: Search public correlations for a given effect
api_list.description: Returns average of all correlations and votes for all public cause variable for a given effect.

required_parameters.name: variablename
required_parameters.description: Effect variable name

api_list.name: Measurements
api_list.description: Get measurements for this user. Measurements are any value that can be recorded like daily steps, a mood rating, or apples eaten.

required_parameters.name: variablename
required_parameters.description: Name of the variable you want measurements for

optional_parameters.name: unit
optional_parameters.description: The unit your want the measurements in

optional_parameters.name: startTime
optional_parameters.description: The lower limit of measurements returned (Epoch)

optional_parameters.name: endTime
optional_parameters.description: The upper limit of measurements returned (Epoch)

optional_parameters.name: groupingWidth
optional_parameters.description: The time (in seconds) over which measurements are grouped together

optional_parameters.name: groupingTimezone
optional_parameters.description: The time (in seconds) over which measurements are grouped together

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: The LIMIT is used to limit the number of results returned. So if you have 1000 results, but only want to the first 10, you would set this to 10 and offset to 0.

optional_parameters.name: offset
optional_parameters.description: Now suppose you wanted to show results 11-20. You'd set the offset to 10 and the limit to 10.

optional_parameters.name: sort
optional_parameters.description: Sort by given field. If the field is prefixed with `-, it will sort in descending order.

api_list.name: Get all available units
api_list.description: Get all available units

optional_parameters.name: unitName
optional_parameters.description: Unit Name

optional_parameters.name: abbreviatedUnitName
optional_parameters.description: Restric the results to a specific unit by providing the unit abbreviation

optional_parameters.name: categoryName
optional_parameters.description: Restrict the results to a specific unit category by  providing the unit category name.

api_list.name: List Connectors
api_list.description: A connector pulls data from other data providers using their API or a screenscraper. Returns a list of all available connectors and information about them such as their id, name, whether the user has provided access, logo url, connection instructions, and the update history.

api_list.name: Pairs
api_list.description: Pairs cause measurements with effect measurements grouped over the duration of action after the onset delay.

required_parameters.name: cause
required_parameters.description: Original variable name for the explanatory or independent variable

required_parameters.name: effect
required_parameters.description: Original variable name for the outcome or dependent variable

optional_parameters.name: duration
optional_parameters.description: Duration of action (in seconds) from the cause variable settings.

optional_parameters.name: delay
optional_parameters.description: Delay before onset of action (in seconds) from the cause variable settings.

optional_parameters.name: startTime
optional_parameters.description: The earliest date (in epoch time) for which we should return measurements

optional_parameters.name: endTime
optional_parameters.description: The most recent date (in epoch time) for which we should return measurements

optional_parameters.name: causeSource
optional_parameters.description: Name of data source that the cause measurements should come from

optional_parameters.name: effectSource
optional_parameters.description: Name of data source that the effectmeasurements should come from

optional_parameters.name: causeUnit
optional_parameters.description: Abbreviated name for the unit cause measurements to be returned in

optional_parameters.name: effectUnit
optional_parameters.description: Abbreviated name for the unit effect measurements to be returned in

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: The LIMIT is used to limit the number of results returned. So if you have 1000 results, but only want to the first 10, you would set this to 10 and offset to 0.

optional_parameters.name: offset
optional_parameters.description: Now suppose you wanted to show results 11-20. You'd set the offset to 10 and the limit to 10.

optional_parameters.name: sort
optional_parameters.description: Sort by given field. If the field is prefixed with `-, it will sort in descending order.

api_list.description: The variable categories include Activity, Causes of Illness, Cognitive Performance, Conditions, Environment, Foods, Location, Miscellaneous, Mood, Nutrition, Physical Activity, Physique, Sleep, Social Interactions, Symptoms, Treatments, Vital Signs, and Work.

api_list.name: Units for Variable
api_list.description: Get a list of all possible units to use for a given variable

optional_parameters.name: variable
optional_parameters.description: Name of the variable you want units for

optional_parameters.name: abbreviatedunitname
optional_parameters.description: Abbreviated Unit Name of the unit you want

optional_parameters.name: categoryname
optional_parameters.description: Name of the category you want units for

optional_parameters.name: unitname

api_list.name: Search user correlations for a given cause filtered by organization
api_list.description: Returns average of all correlations and votes for all user cause variables for a given effect. If parameter "include_public" is used, it also returns public correlations. User correlation overwrites or supersedes public correlation.

required_parameters.name: organization_token
required_parameters.description: Organization access token

optional_parameters.name: include_public
optional_parameters.description: Include bublic correlations, Can be "1" or empty.

api_list.name: Search user correlation for a given effect filtering by organization
api_list.description: Returns average of all correlations and votes for all user cause variables for a given effect. If parameter "include_public" is used, it also returns public correlations. User correlation overwrites or supersedes public correlation.

required_parameters.name: organization_token
required_parameters.description: Organization access token

optional_parameters.name: include_public
optional_parameters.description: Include bublic correlations, Can be "1" or empty.

api_list.name: Search Public Variables
api_list.description: Get top 5 PUBLIC variables with the most correlations containing the entered search characters. For example, search for 'mood' as an effect. Since 'Overall Mood' has a lot of correlations with other variables, it should be in the autocomplete list.

required_parameters.name: search
required_parameters.description: Search query can be some fraction of a variable name.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: The LIMIT is used to limit the number of results returned. So if you have 1000 results, but only want to the first 10, you would set this to 10 and offset to 0.

optional_parameters.name: offset
optional_parameters.description: Now suppose you wanted to show results 11-20. You'd set the offset to 10 and the limit to 10.

optional_parameters.name: sort
optional_parameters.description: Sort by given field. If the field is prefixed with `-, it will sort in descending order.

optional_parameters.name: effectorcause
optional_parameters.description: Allows us to specify which column in the correlations table will be searched. Choices are effect or cause.

api_list.name: Get Access Token
api_list.description: Client provides authorization token obtained from /api/oauth2/authorize to this endpoint and receives an access token.  Access token can then

required_parameters.name: client_id
required_parameters.description: This is the unique ID that QuantiModo uses to identify your application. Obtain a client id by emailing info@quantimo.do.

required_parameters.name: grant_type
required_parameters.description: The grant type can be `authorization_code ` or `refresh_token`

required_parameters.name: client_secret
required_parameters.description: This is the secret for your obtained client_id. QuantiModo uses this to validate that only your application uses the client_id.

optional_parameters.name: response_type
optional_parameters.description: If the value is `code`, launches a Basic flow, requiring a POST to the token endpoint to obtain the tokens. If the value is `token id_token` or `id_token token`, launches an Implicit flow, requiring the use of Javascript at the redirect URI to retrieve tokens from the URI fragment.

optional_parameters.name: scope
optional_parameters.description: Space-delimited set of permissions that the application requests. Scopes include "basic", "readmeasurements", and "writemeasurements". The "basic" scope allows you to read user info (displayname, email, etc). The "readmeasurements" scope allows one to read a user's data. The "writemeasurements" scope allows you to write user data. Separate multiple scopes by a space.

optional_parameters.name: redirect_uri
optional_parameters.description: The redirect URI is the URL within your client application that will receive the OAuth2 credentials.

optional_parameters.name: state
optional_parameters.description: An opaque string that is round-tripped in the protocol; that is to say, it is returned as a URI parameter in the Basic flow, and in the URI

optional_parameters.name: realm
optional_parameters.description: Name of the realm representing the users of your distributed applications and services. A "realm" attribute MAY be included to indicate the scope of protection.
